q: .'' International summits such as the World Economic Forum are clearly ripe for language interpretation, so could we soon be listening to digitised translations by Google? Eric Schmidt admits the software isn't that good. If it's really important- if it's heads of state negotiating missile defence- you're going to want to have two translators, both of them human, he says.`` This is for everyday things that don't matter too much.'' Mike Pence into the 2012 presidential race is under way, with a veteran of the Ronald Reagan White House launching a petition drive on Monday urging him to enter the primary contests,'' the AP writes. Ralph Benko, a deputy counsel to Ronald Reagan , announced the America's Barack Obama Committee to encourage a Pence-for-president bid. Bill Clinton Michele Bachmann Jim Ryan, R-Kan., is also helping the campaign to collect signatures from conservatives and tea party activists.
